name: Jim Spring
bio: Found on the coast of California, Jim has been bit wrangling for a number of years and especially likes digging into new and obscure architectures.  When not poking a stick at computer related things, he can be found on two wheels, in the ocean, or sampling IPAs.

name: JD Marymee
bio: Adrenalin junkie, pilot, sky diver, sailer, coder and in my spare time I shoot Dos Equis commercials

name: Mike Lanzetta
bio: Mike Lanzetta has an interest and enough knowledge to get into trouble in the areas of Machine Learning, Neural Networks, and Distributed Systems. He gets into trouble in plenty of other areas, but has no knowledge of it.

name: Justin Bronder
bio: Codes algorithms, sails yachts, gardens and battles snails, takes photos. Piezophile but not a Hypolith.

name: Matthew Podwysocki
bio: Matthew Podwysocki is a Principal Software Engineer and Open Sourcerer at Microsoft. He has a passion for Reactive Programming at all Scales, IoT, and improving technical education for the next generation of software developers.

name: Tomi Paananen
bio: A software developer from Finland. I don’t care for long walks on the beach, but I do like beer and I wish I owned a cat.

name: Limor Lahiani
bio: An undercover geek, passionate about people and technology

name: Erik Schlegel
bio: As an open source engineer for Microsoft my primary focus is crafting technical solutions to Microsoft’s most strategic partners while using the most emerging and cutting edge open source technologies, and sharing the story with the OSS community through blogs and conferences. We want to show how open source frameworks can be used in conjunction with some amazing Microsoft products like Cortana, Azure and Bing to create a world-class solution for our clients ranging from startup accelerators to large institutions and the developer community.

name: Eric Rozell
bio: Functional reactive programming enthusiast rooted in Cambridge, MA.

name: David Douglas
bio: Turbo ninja web dev, made in Belfast and terrorising London now

name: Jason Poon
bio: Raised in the snowbanks of Canada, Jason feeds on code, and satisfies that daily appetite as a software developer at Microsoft.

name: Andre Price
bio: Software Engineer @ Microsoft - Always interested in learning new tech and helping others apply it

name: Pamela Cortez
bio: Maker badass formerly of Sparkfun and now an IoT evangelist at Microsoft

name: Eero Bragge
bio: Software Engineer that loves languages. Studies Hebrew for fun. Wrote first computer programs with Pascal at Marquette Senior High School in 1986 and made money first-time with AutoCAD Lisp-scripts in 1990. Enjoys motorcycling on race tracks using IoT to help analyze why he is so much slower than 10 year old kids.

name: Michael Platt
bio: As a Director in the Microsoft Strategic Projects group based in Redmond, Washington, Michael Platt is deeply involved in the definition and provision of strategic architectural technical direction and support for Microsoft Corporation in the sports, fitness and assistive technology areas. In this role he works with a number of sports and assistive organizations such as Real Madrid and the Guide Dogs and with sports, fitness and assistive technology providers as well as working on Microsoft Products in these areas. He has extensive knowledge of the use of sensors and analytics in the sport, fitness and assistive technology area. Michael has more than 40 years’ experience in the computer industry. His background includes experience in technical presales, consultancy, research and development, manufacturing, testing, and assurance in a wide variety of senior, leadership, and management roles in both the field and product development. A 20 year Microsoft veteran, Michael has worked a broad range of technical positions in the U.S. and the U.K. Before Michael joined Microsoft, he worked at IBM UK Laboratories Ltd for more than 20 years. Michael is involved in a wide range of strategic projects in sports, fitness and assistive technology with a number of organizations and partners. He is interested in the marketplace, hardware and sensors, the collection, storage and protection of data and the use of Machine Learning and analysis on sports, fitness and assistive data.

name: Petro Soininen
bio: At the crossroads of epic technology and new business. Loves helping people succeed through leadership, tech, creativity and novel hackz.

name: Alex Clemmer
bio: Alex Clemmer is a software engineer at Microsoft. He started the initiative to add Windows support to Mesos. Prior to this, he was a student. Alex is mostly known for turning Snapchat into a remote filesystem and porting lisp to the Apple //e.

name: Jennifer Marsman
bio: When contagious passion meets deep tech and you've got Jennifer Marsman...

name: Bill Barnes
bio: Bill Barnes (@billba) alternates between being a professional cartoonist who writes code and a professional developer who makes comics. Right now he works at Microsoft’s Technical Evangelism and Development group so… probably the latter? Read more at http://bill.barnacle.org

name: Juhana Ilari Sakari Koski
bio: Mobile, embedded and hardware are my jam.

name: Eoin Bailey
bio: Azure master and slayer of bugs large and small, physical and code...

name: Philip Moynagh
bio: Philip B. Moynagh is vice president in the Internet of Things (IoT) Group and general manager of the Quark Solutions Division at Intel Corporation. Based in Ireland, he leads the team responsible for identifying IoT opportunities, translating them into silicon and platform architectures based on Intel® Quark™ technology, and engaging with customers to achieve business transformation.
